TRACE.Definition: something that showed where they were

TAKE HIS LESSONS IN HIS STRIDE.Definition: deal with them with no much worry

PAVEMENT.Definition: the part on one side of a road, that people walk on

DENSELY.Definition: in a crowded manner, with lots of people very closely together

SANITATION.Definition: relating to public health, especially taking dirty water and other waste products away from the buildings

DEVIATE.Definition: start behaving in a different, not usual way

STRAY FROM THE STRAIGHT AND NARROW.Definition: move away from a good and honest way of living

EXTORTION RACKET.Definition: an organised illegal activity in which a group tries to get money from someone by using force or threats

REFUSALS.Definition: statements that he wouldn't do it

FIXED.Definition: influenced its outcome or result by illegal means

STRONG-ARM MAN.Definition: strong man hired to provide protection

STRONG-ARM MEN.Definition: strong men hired to provide protection

THREATS.Definition: suggestions that something bad would happen to them if they wouldn't do what they were told

INTIMIDATION.Definition: actions of frightening or threatening someone

RACKETS.Definition: organised illegal activities in which they tried to get money from someone by using force or threats

THE BRAINS.Definition: the most intelligent person in the group  who planned what they would do

HITMEN.Definition: persons who were paid to kill someone

ECHELONS.Definition: levels or groups within the organisation

KINGPINS.Definition: persons that were very important for the success of the organisation

CONTRADICTION.Definition: something that was the complete opposite of what would have been expected

DENS.Definition: places where people met to engage in an illegal activity

SLANG.Definition: a type of informal language used in a particular context or group of people

BIGWIGS.Definition: people who had important or powerful positions, VIPs

CRACKDOWN.Definition: a situation in which officials had started dealing with the illegal activities

EASILY-BRIBED.Definition: showing interest in receiving money in order to ignore his illegal activities

SYNAGOGUES.Definition: buildings in which Jewish people practice their religion

PLAYGROUND.Definition: a place where they would choose to enjoy themselves

SPANNER IN THE WORKS.Definition: something that didn't go according to plan

SYMPATHETIC EAR.Definition: someone who would be willing to listen to his problems and help him

PLANTING THE SEEDS.Definition: preparing the way, setting the basis

RAN MASSIVELY OVER BUDGET.Definition: was working or functioning far beyond the amount of money that it had been planned for

SYPHONING MONEY OFF.Definition: illegally taking money from the organisation

PROTECTION RACKETS.Definition: organised illegal activities in which a group tries to get money from someone by using threats

PARTICULAR.Definition: insisting that it should be managed according to his way

HOLDING COMPANIES.Definition: companies created to buy and own the shares of other companies

SQUEEZE THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF MONEY OUT.Definition: get as much money as he could from it

COUP.Definition: a sudden, violent, and illegal possession or seizure of power

CRACKED DOWN UPON.Definition: hard to control because of measures taken by the officials

DEN OF INIQUITY.Definition: a place where illegal things were done

CROWN JEWEL.Definition: most important or valuable part or asset

VANISHED INTO THIN AIR.Definition: disappeared completely in a mysterious way

ADD UP.Definition: seem right compared to other information
